intro: Anthonotha mouandzae, commonly known as the Mouandza's anthotha, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that typically range in color from yellow to orange. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in forest understories. Due to its unique appearance and limited distribution, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists alike.
